  • Number of students doing Accounting: 𝑛(𝐴)=26n(A)=26
  • Number of students doing Maths: 𝑛(𝑀)=30n(M)=30

The expressions 𝑛(𝐿𝑆 and 𝐴)n(LS and A) and 𝑛(𝐿𝑆)+𝑛(𝐴)n(LS)+n(A) are not equal. Which of the two expressions is smaller, and why? Select the smaller expression, and the reason from the table below.

Reasons
A 𝑛(𝐿𝑆)+𝑛(𝐴)n(LS)+n(A) counts some students more than once.
B Some students were absent from school that day.
C Some students do not take these 33 subjects.
D 𝑛(𝐿𝑆)+𝑛(𝐴)n(LS)+n(A) does not count all the students.
Answer:

The smaller expression is because of reason .

Their teacher asks each student to tick off the toppings they want on a list. Then the teacher asks them to organise the choices so she can order the most popular combinations of toppings. The students have been studying Venn diagrams. And now they see an opportunity to turn the tables on their teacher. Here is the information they give to her:

  • 22 students want pineapple only.
  • 22 students want onions and salami but not pineapple.
  • 66 students want all three toppings.
  • 88 students want both pineapple and salami.
  • 1717 students want pineapple.

  1. The teacher also knows how to turn the tables. So she gives the information to you and says "Please tell me how many of the students want pineapple and onions but not salami." What is the answer?

    Answer:

    There are students who want pineapple and onions but not salami.

    A any pizza with onions on it.

    C any pizza with salami on it.
    D plain cheese and tomato pizza.
    Answer:

    The least popular pizza is choice .

The students have been studying Venn diagrams. And now they see an opportunity to turn the tables on their teacher. Here is the information they give to her:

  • 66 students want all three toppings.
  • 33 students want pineapple and bacon but not ham.
  • 1414 students want ham and pineapple.
  • 1515 students want ham and bacon.
  • 2727 students want ham.

  1. The teacher also knows how to turn the tables. So she gives the information to you and says "Please tell me how many of the students want ham only." What is the answer?

    Answer:

    There are students who want ham only.

    numeric

  2. If 22 students want nothing but bacon on their pizza and 2121 students want any pizza with pineapple on it, which of the following four pizza choices is least popular?

    The least popular pizza choice is...
    A any pizza with bacon on it.
    B any pizza with ham on it.
    C any pizza with pineapple on it.
    D pizza with all three toppings.
    Answer:

    The least popular pizza is choice .
